lexUnit.name: waggle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move with short quick movements from side to side or up and down.

sentence.text: In the slow bits , I moved away from Emily and waggled my ears .
Swimming with these giant fish ( some weigh 100 kilogrammes ) is an experience to remember , as long as you do n't waggle fingers enticingly .
Giving Ellie a thoughtful look , she suddenly waggled her scarlet-tipped fingers , and walked away .
The bald-headed man caught his stare and waggled his fingers in a friendly fashion .
Lori waggled her fingers and sauntered off , obviously in no hurry to meet the patiently waiting Chuck .
She can lie on her back like an inverted cockroach while waggling her legs in the air .
Waggling his arms and legs in preparation for Islamic dancing , Robert started down the stairs after Rafiq and Dr Ali .
In South America , a horned toad regularly attracts its prey by -- almost unbelievably -- waggling its toes .
She lifted her feet , waggling her toes at me .
Females also demonstrate a type of hierarchy that sees them side-by-side , waggling their bodies to form water currents as a show of strength .
She leaned back and waggled her forefinger to show her disapproval .
Jonathan waggled his finger at the fallen hero .
He extended his arm fully and began to waggle it in an arc across the faces of the congregation .
While running up the centre the dancer waggles her abdomen from side to side .
Every time he said theme or ultimate theme he held up his finger and waggled it in front of his nose .
They sort of clamber out all clumsy like and then they waggle their tails like a dog and then start cleaning their feathers all quick .
It performs a special dance , walking in a circle which it then bisects while vigorously waggling its abdomen .
He waggled his eyebrows .
She waggled suggestive eyebrows , stared at him from under her eyelashes .
Keith leaned back in his chair and waggled his bare feet , looking very pleased with himself .
He looked hopefully at Zen who waggled his finger and walked off up the street .
` - and the bit-- " Rincewind said , waggling a finger solemnly .
Lollo raised one leg and waggled her foot cheekily .
Changez waggled the hand a bit and laughed without self-consciousness ; Anwar tried to laugh too .
` What do you think , Henry ? " she said , waggling her head about .
Wedged inside that drum he drowned , his little legs waggling pathetically as he gulped and squirmed and tried to get his arms into a position from which he could lever himself out .
My voice had risen a good half-octave and my hands were waggling around on the end of my arms as though I was trying to shake off bits of Sellotape. ` rather soon ? "
His arm waggled , as if he were groping for something , and then his hand appeared as softly and suddenly as it had vanished : holding the fifth ball .
